vocabInfos.lsjDefs:
διᾱκον-ία, ἡ,
service, [Refs 5th c.BC+]
__2 attendance on a duty, ministration, [Refs 4th c.BC+]; ἡ δ. ἡ καθημερινή, of ministering to external wants, [NT]
__II body of servants or attendants, [Refs 2nd c.BC+]
__III instruments of service, ={διακόνημα}[Refs 4th c.BC+]
vocabInfos.shortDef: ministry, service, this can refer to helps and service of various kinds which can range in meaning from "spiritual" biblical teaching (<ref='Act.6.4'>Act.6:4</ref>) to the "practical" giving of provisions, supplies, support, and finances to those in need (<ref='2Co.9.12'>2Co.9:12</ref>)
vocabInfos.mediumDef:
ministry, service, this can refer to helps and service of various kinds which can range in meaning from "spiritual" biblical teaching (Act.6:4) to the "practical" giving of provisions, supplies, support, and finances to those in need (2Co.9:12)
serving, service, waiting, attendance, the act of rendering friendly offices, Lk. 10:40; 2Tim. 4:11; Heb. 1:14; relief, aid, Acts 6:1; 11:29; 2Cor. 8:4; 9:1, 12, 13; a commission, Acts 12:25; Rom. 15:31; a commission or ministry in the service of the Gospel, Acts 1:17, 25; 20:24; Rom. 11:13; 2Cor. 4:1; 5:18; 1Tim. 1:12; service in the Gospel, Acts 6:4; 21:19; 1Cor. 16:15; 2Cor. 6:3; 11:8; Eph. 4:12; Rev. 2:19; a function, ministry, or office in the Church, Rom. 12:7; 1Cor. 12:5; Col. 4:17; 2Tim. 4:5; a ministering in the conveyance of a revelation from God, 2Cor. 3:7, 8, 9
vocabInfos._es_Definition: ministerio, servicio ; contribución, ayuda, apoyo, sostén ; misión ; tal vez cargo de diácono o autoridad (ROM.12:7)
